dt: {bc}any of the filamentous bands of {a_link|nervous} tissue that connect parts of the nervous system with the other organs, conduct nerve impulses, and are made up of axons and dendrites together with protective and supportive structures

pt: {sc}temerity{/sc} {sc}audacity{/sc} {sc}hardihood{/sc} {sc}effrontery{/sc} {sc}nerve{/sc} {sc}cheek{/sc} {sc}gall{/sc} {sc}chutzpah{/sc} mean conspicuous or flagrant boldness. {sc}temerity{/sc} suggests boldness arising from rashness and contempt of danger.
{sc}audacity{/sc} implies a disregard of restraints commonly imposed by convention or prudence.
{sc}hardihood{/sc} suggests firmness in daring and defiance.
{sc}effrontery{/sc} implies shameless, insolent disregard of propriety or courtesy.

pt.t: has the {it}cheek{/it} to call herself a singer
the {it}chutzpah{/it} needed for a career in show business

et: Latin {it}nervus{/it} sinew, nerve; akin to Greek {it}neuron{/it} sinew, nerve, {it}nēn{/it} to spin {ma}{mat|needle|}{/ma}
shortdef: any of the filamentous bands of nervous tissue that connect parts of the nervous system with the other organs, conduct nerve impulses, and are made up of axons and dendrites together with protective and supportive structures
power of endurance or control : fortitude, strength

dt: {bc}to give strength or courage to {bc}supply with physical or moral force

shortdef: to give strength or courage to : supply with physical or moral force

dt: {bc}an impressive ability to remain calm in dangerous or difficult situations

dt.t: It takes {it}nerves of steel{/it} to work in such a high-pressure job.

shortdef: an impressive ability to remain calm in dangerous or difficult situations

dt: {bc}a conflict characterized by psychological tactics (such as bluff, threats, and intimidation) designed primarily to create confusion, indecision, or breakdown of morale

shortdef: a conflict characterized by psychological tactics (such as bluff, threats, and intimidation) designed primarily to create confusion, indecision, or breakdown of morale

dt.t: He was {it}a bundle of nerves{/it} before his speech.
That car alarm is {it}getting on my nerves{/it}.

shortdef: to become extremely annoying to someone

dt.t: He took a deep breath to try to calm his {it}jangled nerves{/it}.

dt: {bc}to make someone feel very nervous and tense

dt.t: The pressure of performing {it}jangled her nerves{/it}.

shortdef: to make someone feel very nervous and tense

dt.t: She took a drink to try to {it}steady her nerves{/it}.

shortdef: to make one/someone calm or calmer
